hackathon-description-text: The idea of hackathon at LSU was first floated around by a disgruntled student that attended one of the many fantastic hackathons available in the north and west. He later could not find any near Baton Rouge. A group of undergraduates, who all share the same sentiments as the disgruntled student, got together to plan a hackathon at LSU; "GeauxHack" was born. With the support of LSU STEM Talent Expansion Program, and other possible sponsors, we are hoping ot make GeauxHack Happen.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 Check and Dell tablet for all team members
Leap Motion controllers for the team with the best hack using Leap Motion.
iPad mini for the hack that most creatively use Ziggeo API.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Coates Hall, Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How original and creative, or is the project novel
Is the app solve a problem we face everyday? Would you use this project? Is it practical?
Was the hack technically very difficult? Or there is alot technically challenge to overcome.

hackathon-location-address: Coates Hall, Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
hackathon-description-header: GeauxHack will be the first 24 hour MLH hackathon at LSU. Students are encouraged to come with enthusiasm, ideas, and enough energy to collaborate and create a product overnight.
